commands.name: az sphere device assign
commands.summary: Assign a device to a device group in your resource group and catalog.
examples: az sphere device assign --resource-group MyResourceGroup --catalog MyCatalog --target-product MyProduct --target-device-group MyCurrentDeviceGroup --device <DeviceIdValue>

commands.name: az sphere device claim
commands.summary: Claim a device in your resource group and catalog.
examples: az sphere device claim --resource-group MyResourceGroup --catalog MyCatalog --device <DeviceIdValue>
az sphere device claim --resource-group MyResourceGroup --catalog MyCatalog --product MyProduct --device-group MyDeviceGroup --device <DeviceIdValue>

commands.name: az sphere device enable-cloud-test
commands.summary: Enable a device for testing cloud loading by disabling development and debugging on the attached device, and by assigning it to a device group that enables application updates from the cloud. By default, this will be the Field Test device group of the device's product, but other device groups can be specified. Not for use in manufacturing scenarios: see https://aka.ms/AzureSphereManufacturing for more information.
examples: az sphere device enable-cloud-test --resource-group MyResourceGroup --catalog MyCatalog --device <DeviceIdValue>
az sphere device enable-cloud-test --resource-group MyResourceGroup --catalog MyCatalog --product MyProduct --device-group MyDeviceGroup --device <DeviceIdValue>

commands.name: az sphere device enable-development
commands.summary: Enable a device for development by enabling sideloading and debugging on the attached device, and by assigning it to a device group that disables application updates from the cloud. By default, this will be the Development device group of the device's product, but other device groups can be specified. Not for use in manufacturing scenarios: see https://aka.ms/AzureSphereManufacturing for more information.
examples: az sphere device enable-development --resource-group MyResourceGroup --catalog MyCatalog --device <DeviceIdValue>
az sphere device enable-development --resource-group MyResourceGroup --catalog MyCatalog --product MyProduct --device-group MyDeviceGroup --device <DeviceIdValue>

commands.name: az sphere device list
commands.summary: List all the devices in your catalog, product, or device group.
examples: az sphere device list --resource-group MyResourceGroup --catalog MyCatalog
az sphere device list --resource-group MyResourceGroup --catalog MyCatalog --product MyProduct
az sphere device list --resource-group MyResourceGroup --catalog MyCatalog --product MyProduct --device-group MyDeviceGroup

commands.name: az sphere device list-attached
examples: az sphere device list-attached

commands.name: az sphere device recover
commands.summary: Use recovery mode to load new firmware onto the attached device.
examples: az sphere device recover
az sphere device recover --capability myCapability.cap --images myImagesFolder

commands.name: az sphere device rescan-attached
commands.summary: Show the number of attached devices.
examples: az sphere device rescan-attached

commands.name: az sphere device restart
examples: az sphere device restart
az sphere device restart --device <DeviceIdValue>

commands.name: az sphere device show
commands.summary: Show details of an existing device in your resource group and catalog.
examples: az sphere device show --resource-group MyResourceGroup --catalog MyCatalog --device <DeviceIdValue>

commands.name: az sphere device show-attached
commands.summary: Show the details of the attached device.
examples: az sphere device show-attached
az sphere device show-attached --device <DeviceIdValue>

commands.name: az sphere device show-count
commands.summary: Show the number of devices in your catalog, product, or device group.
examples: az sphere device show-count --resource-group MyResourceGroup --catalog MyCatalog
az sphere device show-count --resource-group MyResourceGroup --catalog MyCatalog --product MyProduct
az sphere device show-count --resource-group MyResourceGroup --catalog MyCatalog --product MyProduct --device-group MyDeviceGroup

commands.name: az sphere device show-deployment-status
commands.summary: Show the deployment status of the operating system on a device.
examples: az sphere device show-deployment-status --resource-group MyResourceGroup --catalog MyCatalog --device <DeviceIdValue>

commands.name: az sphere device show-os-version
commands.summary: Show the operating system version on the attached device.
examples: az sphere device show-os-version
az sphere device show-os-version --device <DeviceIdValue>

commands.name: az sphere device unassign
commands.summary: Unassign a device from a device group in your resource group and catalog.
examples: az sphere device unassign --resource-group MyResourceGroup --catalog MyCatalog --device <DeviceIdValue>
